remarks: An infinite sum of nonnegative terms is nonnegative.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2014.)
statement:
isumrecl.1 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
isumrecl.2 $e |- ( ph -> M e. ZZ ) $.
isumrecl.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( F ` k ) = A ) $.
isumrecl.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> A e. RR ) $.
isumrecl.5 $e |- ( ph -> seq M ( + , F ) e. dom ~~> ) $.
isumge0.6 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> 0 <_ A ) $.
isumge0 $p |- ( ph -> 0 <_ sum_ k e. Z A ) $.
$d F k $.
$d M k $.
$d Z k $.
$d k ph $.
